wikipedia_page.main:
Frank Parr (17 December 1918 – 28 December 2003) was an English chess player who was born in Wandsworth.
He was British Boys (Under 18) champion in 1935.

response: * Hastings International Chess Congress won by Frank Parr, 1939/40.

*Frank ParrDefeated Edward Guthlac Sergeant in the 1960 British Championship

Frank Parr played first-class cricket for Lancashire primarily as a wicketkeeper and a lower-order batsman, in his career of 49 matches spanning from 1951 to 1954. Herbert Strudwick said that he was "the most promising keeper I've seen in years", and in 1952 he was tipped to play for England. At the end of the following season he was almost selected for that winter's tour of the West Indies.
